content.raw:
Is this 100 timeout depending on machine performance? If so, my personal opinion is that we should stop coding timeouts in this manner and rely on gtest own timeout for killing tests in case of they get stuck.

If we want to control the time used by an action (here the grasp time) is not changing (mostly increase) in an unreasonable manner, let's transform this into a performance test.
content.html:
Is this 100 timeout depending on machine performance? If so, my personal opinion is that we should stop coding timeouts in this manner and rely on gtest own timeout for killing tests in case of they get stuck.

If we want to control the time used by an action (here the grasp time) is not changing (mostly increase) in an unreasonable manner, let's transform this into a performance test.
